abstract: Former New York City mayor Rudolph W. Giuliani is getting support from some high-flying financiers as he considers whether to run for president in 2008. Data published on Wednesday by PoliticalMoneyLine.com show that contributors to Mr. Giuliani’s presidential exploratory committee, formed in November, include T. Boone Pickens, the Texas mogul who runs the hedge fund BP Capital Management; and Paul Tudor Jones II, the chairman of the hedge fund Tudor Investment Corporation. The fund also got money from Carl C. Icahn, the billionaire investor, filings show.
lead_paragraph: Former New York City mayor Rudolph W. Giuliani is getting support from some high-flying financiers as he considers whether to run for president in 2008. Data published on Wednesday by PoliticalMoneyLine.com show that contributors to Mr. Giuliani’s presidential exploratory committee, formed in November, include T. Boone Pickens, the Texas mogul who runs the hedge fund BP Capital Management; and Paul Tudor Jones II, the chairman of the hedge fund Tudor Investment Corporation. The fund also got money from Carl C. Icahn, the billionaire investor, filings show.

headline.main: Hedge Fund Moguls Back Giuliani’s Presidential Fund
